name: Royal On The Park

reviews.text: I have chosen to stay at this hotel due to its great position which is right opposite the Botanical Gardens and a very short walk to Edward Street and Queen Street Mall.
reviews.title: Homely hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed for 5 nights in total. It was very good value for money!
reviews.title: Good location, quiet, comfortable room & fantastic customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel gave an olde feeling as one walked in. The reception staff was very professional and helpful.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel - quiet, comfortable and understated

reviews.text: The room that I was given faced the swimming pool. As I was quite high up, the view was of the buildings across the road which was not unpleasant.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Brisbane

reviews.text: The room is spacious and clean. When I walked into the room, there was 2 teddy bears on the bed which one could buy as souvenir. They brought smiles to my face!
reviews.title: Old charm but modern rooms and great location
Efficient with character
reviews.text: I have stayed here a couple of times now. The staff are efficient and the rooms and beds comfortable. Most of all it retains its character. The botanical gardens across the road are great for a morning run.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well situated,close to the Botanical Gardens,South Bank and downtown.
reviews.title: Good Location.A tired Hotel

reviews.text: Check in Staff polite and courteous.
reviews.title: Amazing service from arrival to departure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room clean
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
Terrific place
reviews.text: The whole Hotel had a tired feel to it.

Your stay at the Royal on the Park was just fantastic. The Walnut Restrauant manager Rudy was superb and the food was fantastic. The front desk staff are friendly. Our room was very comfortinle had we had view of the park.Just a short walk and you are on the middle of the city.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: A very enjoyable stay
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My opinion with the hotel is that 1. the restaurant has 0 children options 2.The pool could at least be heated 3. i think they concentrate on elegance more then reality. 4. the ipad games need an update they are all for 4 year old most of those games. 5. they have a really good carpark.
reviews.title: 'Old Club' Charm (Suite)

reviews.text: My husband and I picked this stay via internet as we were on opposite sides of the Pacific and wanted something special. This Hotel definitely suited our desires.
reviews.title: Same time every year...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + Location opposite the Botanical Gardens meant we had total privacy in the lounge room with a wonderful view.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only write about staying in a suite.
reviews.title: Quickest stress reliever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I loved the 'old club' decor combined with some very interesting re-lifing touches.
reviews.title: Great Location, just a little tired

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The subdued atmosphere and excellent location suited us as it helped both of us 'let go' of our hectic work lives.
reviews.title: mixed emotions

reviews.text: Buffet breakfast, though not as extensive in food diversity as other places, is definitely worth eating and we sadly made the mistake of going down to the river on our first morning (Sunday). Hindsight is a wonderful thing!
reviews.title: A little tired but good value

reviews.text: Initially, I wasn't 'thrilled' with the spa bath being off the lounge room but it was wonderful to lie back, with curtains open, looking at the Botanical Gardens knowing no-one could see in.
reviews.title: Not royalty... but pretty good

aka: Royal On The Park Hotel Brisbane
description: Royal on the Park is conveniently located just a 5 minute stroll away from Brisbane's CBD and popular Queen Street Mall shopping precinct. Facing the Beautiful Botanic Gardens at the green end of the CBD, it gives the feeling of being in a calm oasis. Outside the front door, age-old Moreton Bay fig trees, soaring bamboo and ancient travellers' palms stand sentinel opposite the hotel. Royal on the Park features 153 spacious guest rooms and suites, tailoring amenities and services to both leisure and business travellers! All guests, diners and delegates can enjoy complimentary hi speed wifi with no download limits. The Walnut Restaurant has consistently remained a favourite venue for local visitors and regular hotel diners. Ask about our new a la carte menu featuring fresh local produce from Queensland farmers. For those with fitness in mind, the largest in-ground hotel pool in Brisbane together with spa and top floor gymnasium provide the freedom to relax and unwind or to enjoy an energetic work-out. A kick start to the day is made easy with an invigorating early morning jog around the numerous pathways of the Botanic Gardens. The hotel is well renowned for its in room facilities. Combining digital free to air television, Foxtel and satellite channels from around the world. A wide selection of pay per view blockbuster movies and favourites for adults and children alike. 37 radio stations combining local AM and FM channels with international flavour. This combines for a total of 188 viewing and listening opportunities. Whether you are looking for a conference venue, planning a Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner or perhaps even a Wedding, the hotel has up to 8 elegant function rooms to select from, catering up to 800 cocktail style or 400 banquet style. Guests of Royal on the Park are well placed to enjoy the range of leisure activities in Brisbane. It's just a boardwalk stroll along the water's edge to the Riverside Markets and an abundance of restaurants and al fresco cafes.
